Parameters.name: identifier
Parameters.description: The identifier of the data to retrieve, e.g., sequence ID.

Parameters.name: frmt
Parameters.description: The format of the retrieved data, e.g., xml, text, fasta etc.

Parameters.name: fasta_range
Parameters.description: Subsequence ranges for fasta data, e.g., bases [3, 63].

Parameters.name: expanded
Parameters.description: Whether to retrieve expanded CON records.

Parameters.name: header
Parameters.description: If set, retrieves the sequence header.

Parameters.name: download
Parameters.description: Determines if the data should be downloaded directly.

Returns.description: The retrieved data in the requested format (e.g., XML, text).

get_data.Docstring:
Retrieve data from the ENA database in the desired format and configuration.

Parameters:
-----------
identifier : str
    The identifier of the data to retrieve, e.g., sequence ID.
frmt : str
    The format of the retrieved data, e.g., xml, text, fasta etc.
fasta_range : Optional[list], optional
    Subsequence ranges for fasta data, e.g., bases [3, 63].
expanded : Optional[bool], optional
    Whether to retrieve expanded CON records.
header : Optional[bool], optional
    If set, retrieves the sequence header.
download : Optional[bool], optional
    Determines if the data should be downloaded directly.

Returns:
--------
str
    The retrieved data in the requested format (e.g., XML, text).

Examples:
--------
>>> from bioservices import ENA
>>> e = ENA()
>>> e.get_data('ERA000092', 'xml')
get_data.api_calling: bioservices.ENA.get_data(identifier=$, frmt=$, fasta_range=$, expanded=$, header=$, download=$)
